meanings.definition: A person who holds something jointly with another.
meanings.sent1: My sister is my coholder of the family heirloom.
meanings.sent2: The coholder of the business shares equal responsibility.
meanings.sent3: The coholder of the secret recipe always forgets the main ingredient!
meanings.sent4: Being a coholder of the treasure map felt like being part of a thrilling adventure.
meanings.sent5: As a coholder of the key, he had the power to unlock the ancient chest.

meanings.definition: To hold something jointly with another person.
meanings.sent1: We coholder the decision on where to go for our vacation.
meanings.sent2: They coholder the ownership of the land and work together on its maintenance.
meanings.sent3: Let's coholder the responsibility of feeding the fish in the tank!
meanings.sent4: The two friends coholdered the task of building a treehouse in the backyard.
meanings.sent5: Coholding the secret with her best friend made it easier to bear.
